Constructor Detail

TriangleShape

public TriangleShape(double width,
                     double height,
                     boolean filled)
Constructs a triangular shape. It connects the points (0,0), (0, height), and (width, height/2), where the coordinates are interpreted relative to the shape's lower left corner. The shape's hotSpot mode is set to Shape.CENTER.

Parameters:
width - the shape's width
height - the shape's height

TriangleShape

public TriangleShape(double x0,
                     double y0,
                     double x1,
                     double y1,
                     double x2,
                     double y2,
                     boolean filled)
Constructs a triangular shape. It creates a triangle that is congruent to the triangle defined by the three points (x1, y1), (x2, y2), and (x3, y3). The triangles coordinates are shifted so that it fits into a rectangle whith a lower left corner at (0,0). The rectangle's width and height are defined so that the triangle fits tightly inside the rectangle. The shape's hot spot is set to Shape.CENTER.

Parameters:
x0 - x coordinate of first point
y0 - y coordinate of first point
x1 - x coordinate of second point
y1 - y coordinate of second point
x2 - x coordinate of third point
y2 - y coordinate of third point
Method Detail

clone

protected java.lang.Object clone()
Creates and returns a copy of this shape.

Overrides:
clone in class Shape

setSize

public void setSize(double width,
                    double height)
Description copied from class: Shape
Sets the new dimension to be width and height measured in pixels. Adjusts the hotSpot point as necessary. The hotSpot point remains unchanged if the hotSpot mode equals FIXED_POINT.

Overrides:
setSize in class Shape
Parameters:
width - new width; must be greater zero
height - new height; must be greater zero

getPointX

public double getPointX(int i)
Returns the x coordinate of one of the triangle's points. The coordinate is given relative to the shape's hotSpot.

Parameters:
i - must be 0, 1, or 2
Returns:
x coordinate of first, second, or third corner point

getPointY

public double getPointY(int i)
Returns the y coordinate of one of the triangle's points. The coordinate is given relative to the shape's hotSpot.

Parameters:
i - must be 0, 1, or 2
Returns:
y coordinate of first, second, or third corner point
